title: what is the name of these fonts?
content:
What is the name of the font in the logo? - sweet paper  
What is the name of the hand written looking font on the bottom left?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [3466238-8840276-thumbnail.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336/http:/typophile.com/files/3466238-8840276-thumbnail.jpg) | 58.38 KB |
| [infinity2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336/http:/typophile.com/files/infinity2.jpg) | 29.69 KB |
author: karent0510

comments.content:
The bottom left of the Infinity logo isnt hand written, it looks like weights of Copperplate. The right looks like Cariola Script or Carpenter Script.  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/image-club/cariola-script/regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336/http:/www.fonts.com/font/image-club/cariola-script/regular "http://www.fonts.com/font/image-club/cariola-script/regular")

I suppose you mean the "Infinity" script at bottom right?  
It is published as **[Carpenter Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/carpenter/)** by James West (GroupType, 1993-06), also published as **[Carpenter ICG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Image-Club-Graphics&ffam=Carpenter%20ICG%20-%20Regular&fid=ed5f15f3d21a6471339c40baed679c07&fsize=60&text=Infinity&fit=1)** by Image Club Graphics and digitized as **Carpenter Script** by Dan X. Solo. (1999, Dover Publications CD)  
It's also available as **OPTICarmella HandScript** (Castcraft Software, Inc. 1990-1991) and cloned under different names by several well-known font forgery companies like NovelFonts, FontBank & SoftMaker.

I don't know what "sweet paper" is, but some contrast & perspective correction might help somebody else to find out:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sweet-paper-01_5594.jpg)

"sweet paper" and most of the rest on the first sample is [Brownstone Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101122336/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/brownstone-sans) (possibly the ornamental frame too).
